segments.source_content:
---
slug: /179
title: "This Week In React #179: useActionState, Redwood, Waku, Astro, Pre-rendering, Bun, Kotekan, memo, Radix, shadcn/ui, React-Navigation, RN-Screens, CodePush, VisionOS, TypeScript, Node.js..."
authors: [slorber, bndkt]
date: 03-27-2024
---

segments.source_content: Hi everyone!

translations.fr: Bonjour √† tous !
translations.en: Bonjour √† tous !

segments.source_content: Another week full of interesting news! I found many links, and saved a few of them for next week, which should be a quiet one due to Easter Monday.

translations.fr: Une autre semaine riche en actualit√©s passionnantes ! J'ai collect√© de nombreux liens et en ai r√©serv√© quelques-uns pour la semaine prochaine, qui devrait √™tre plus calme avec le lundi de P√¢ques.
translations.en: Une autre semaine riche en actualit√©s passionnantes ! J'ai trouv√© de nombreux liens et en ai conserv√© quelques-uns pour la semaine prochaine, qui devrait √™tre plus calme en raison du lundi de P√¢ques.

segments.source_content: It's exciting to see Waku and Redwood becoming stronger meta-frameworks, and new innovative experiments built on top of Bun such as Kotekan and a pre-rendering macro.

translations.fr: C'est enthousiasmant de voir Waku et Redwood s'affirmer comme m√©ta-frameworks solides, et de nouvelles exp√©rimentations innovantes bas√©es sur Bun comme Kotekan et une macro de pr√©-rendu.
translations.en: C'est passionnant de voir Waku et Redwood renforcer leur position en tant que m√©ta-frameworks, ainsi que de nouvelles exp√©rimentations innovantes bas√©es sur Bun comme Kotekan et une macro de pr√©-rendu.

segments.source_content: React Native also has interesting updates, notably a React Navigation v7 sneak peek, and a nice React Native Screen upgrade.

translations.fr: React Native pr√©sente aussi des mises √† jour int√©ressantes, notamment un aper√ßu de React Navigation v7 et une belle am√©lioration de React Native Screen.
translations.en: React Native pr√©sente √©galement des mises √† jour int√©ressantes, notamment un aper√ßu de React Navigation v7 et une belle am√©lioration de React Native Screen.

segments.source_content: I was at [React.paris](https://react.paris/) last week. It was a really great conf, and it was nice to meet some of you! It's great that Paris is finally back in the React conf game.

translations.fr: J'√©tais pr√©sent √† [React.paris](https://react.paris/) la semaine derni√®re. Une conf√©rence vraiment excellente, et ce fut un plaisir d'y rencontrer certains d'entre vous ! C'est formidable que Paris retrouve enfin sa place dans l'√©cosyst√®me des conf√©rences React.
translations.en: J'√©tais √† [React.paris](https://react.paris/) la semaine derni√®re. C'√©tait une conf√©rence vraiment g√©niale, et ce fut un plaisir de rencontrer certains d'entre vous ! C'est formidable que Paris soit enfin de retour dans le paysage des conf√©rences React.

segments.source_content: The party is not over, because next month we also have [React Connection](https://reactconnection.io/) and [React Native Connection](https://reactnativeconnection.io/) on 22-23 April in Paris! The newsletter is once again a conf media partner. You can get a [-20% discount](https://www.billetweb.fr/react-connection-2024?discount=TWIR) with the code "TWIR", and we'll run a ticket giveaway on Twitter this Friday.

translations.fr: L'√©v√©nement n'est pas termin√©, car le mois prochain nous aurons aussi [React Connection](https://reactconnection.io/) et [React Native Connection](https://reactnativeconnection.io/) les 22-23 avril √† Paris ! La newsletter est √† nouveau partenaire m√©dia. Vous pouvez b√©n√©ficier d'une [-20% de r√©duction](https://www.billetweb.fr/react-connection-2024?discount=TWIR) avec le code "TWIR", et nous organiserons un concours de billets sur Twitter ce vendredi.
translations.en: La f√™te n'est pas termin√©e, car le mois prochain nous aurons √©galement [React Connection](https://reactconnection.io/) et [React Native Connection](https://reactnativeconnection.io/) les 22-23 avril √† Paris ! La newsletter est √† nouveau partenaire m√©dia. Vous pouvez b√©n√©ficier d'une [r√©duction de -20%](https://www.billetweb.fr/react-connection-2024?discount=TWIR) avec le code "TWIR", et nous organiserons un concours de billets sur Twitter ce vendredi.

segments.source_content: **[React-admin: The Open-Source Framework for B2B apps](https://marmelab.com/react-admin/)**

translations.fr: **[React-admin : Le framework open-source pour les applications B2B](https://marmelab.com/react-admin/)**
translations.en: **[React-admin : Le framework open-source pour les applications B2B](https://marmelab.com/react-admin/)**

segments.source_content: With 23k stars and 500,000 daily users, react-admin is the framework of choice for single-page applications (ERPs, Admins, B2B apps). Compatible with Vite, Next, and Remix, it builds upon acclaimed libraries like react-hook-form, react-query, react-router and material-ui to accelerate your development game.

translations.fr: Avec 23k √©toiles et 500 000 utilisateurs quotidiens, react-admin est le framework de choix pour les applications monopage (ERPs, interfaces d'administration, applications B2B). Compatible avec Vite, Next et Remix, il s'appuie sur des biblioth√®ques reconnues comme react-hook-form, react-query, react-router et material-ui pour acc√©l√©rer votre d√©veloppement.
translations.en: Avec 23k √©toiles et 500 000 utilisateurs quotidiens, react-admin est le framework de choix pour les applications monopages (ERP, interfaces d'administration, B2B). Compatible avec Vite, Next et Remix, il s'appuie sur des biblioth√®ques renomm√©es comme react-hook-form, react-query, react-router et material-ui pour acc√©l√©rer votre d√©veloppement.

segments.source_content: [![React Server Components now in RedwoodJS](/emails/issues/179/redwood.jpg)](https://redwoodjs.com/blog/rsc-now-in-redwoodjs)

translations.fr: [![Les composants serveur React d√©sormais dans RedwoodJS](/emails/issues/179/redwood.jpg)](https://redwoodjs.com/blog/rsc-now-in-redwoodjs)
translations.en: [![Les composants serveur React d√©sormais dans RedwoodJS](/emails/issues/179/redwood.jpg)](https://redwoodjs.com/blog/rsc-now-in-redwoodjs)

segments.source_content: [**React Server Components now in RedwoodJS**](https://redwoodjs.com/blog/rsc-now-in-redwoodjs)

translations.fr: [**Les composants serveur React d√©sormais dans RedwoodJS**](https://redwoodjs.com/blog/rsc-now-in-redwoodjs)
translations.en: [**Les composants serveur React d√©sormais dans RedwoodJS**](https://redwoodjs.com/blog/rsc-now-in-redwoodjs)

segments.source_content: Bighorn, the next Redwood ‚Äúepoch‚Äù starting at v8.0, will bet all-in on React Server Components. This article explains why Redwood now prefers RSCs over GraphQL, which wasn‚Äôt the best DX to get started with for most devs and projects. GraphQL will remain supported and can be used alongside RSCs in the same app. Redwood Cells now allow you to export a new ‚Äúdata‚Äù function to load the Cell data.

translations.fr: Bighorn, la prochaine "√©poque" de Redwood d√©marrant en v8.0, misera enti√®rement sur les composants serveur React (RSC). Cet article explique pourquoi Redwood pr√©f√®re d√©sormais les RSC √† GraphQL, qui n'offrait pas la meilleure exp√©rience d√©veloppeur (DX) initiale pour la plupart des d√©veloppeurs et projets. GraphQL restera pris en charge et pourra √™tre utilis√© conjointement aux RSC dans la m√™me application. Les Cellules Redwood permettent d√©sormais d'exporter une nouvelle fonction "data" pour charger les donn√©es de la cellule.
translations.en: Bighorn, la prochaine "√®re" de Redwood d√©marrant en v8.0, misera enti√®rement sur les composants serveur React (RSC). Cet article explique pourquoi Redwood pr√©f√®re d√©sormais les RSC √† GraphQL, qui n'offrait pas la meilleure exp√©rience d√©veloppeur (DX) pour d√©marrer la plupart des projets. GraphQL restera pris en charge et pourra √™tre utilis√© conjointement avec les RSC. Les Cellules Redwood permettent d√©sormais d'exporter une nouvelle fonction "data" pour charger les donn√©es de la cellule.

segments.source_content: You can try Redwood Bighorn today as a v8 canary release, but there are still many rough edges mentioned in the blog post, that they‚Äôll fix before the official major release. There‚Äôs another interesting article to read [comparing Redwood routing conventions to Next.js and Remix](https://redwoodjs.com/blog/whats-different-comparing-the-router-in-nextjs-app-api-nextjs-pages-api-remix-and-redwoodjs).

translations.fr: Vous pouvez essayer Redwood Bighorn aujourd'hui en version canari v8, mais il subsiste encore de nombreuses imperfections mentionn√©es dans l'article de blog, qu'ils corrigeront avant la sortie officielle majeure. Il y a un autre article int√©ressant √† lire [comparant les conventions de routage de Redwood √† Next.js et Remix](https://redwoodjs.com/blog/whats-different-comparing-the-router-in-nextjs-app-api-nextjs-pages-api-remix-and-redwoodjs).
translations.en: Vous pouvez essayer Redwood Bighorn d√®s aujourd'hui en version canary v8, mais le billet de blog mentionne encore de nombreuses asp√©rit√©s qui seront corrig√©es avant la sortie officielle majeure. Un autre article int√©ressant √† lire [compare les conventions de routage de Redwood avec Next.js et Remix](https://redwoodjs.com/blog/whats-different-comparing-the-router-in-nextjs-app-api-nextjs-pages-api-remix-and-redwoodjs).

segments.source_content:
- üí∏ [React Universe Conf - We care about a diverse lineup, so we prolong our CFP until April 5. We encourage all women in tech to submit talks!](https://www.reactuniverseconf.com/?utm_campaign=React_Universe_Conf&utm_source=email&utm_content=This_Week_in_React)
- üëÄ [React Core PR - useActionState](https://github.com/facebook/react/pull/28491): The PR is now merged and has been added to the [canary changelog](https://github.com/facebook/react/blob/main/CHANGELOG-canary.md).
- üí¨ [Astro proposal - Form actions](https://github.com/withastro/roadmap/discussions/871): Astro is exploring options for form submissions and mutations to feed their new Astro DB product, taking into consideration React 19 islands using useActionState() and useFormStatus().
- üê¶ [Sebastian Silbermann (React core team) joins Vercel](https://twitter.com/sebsilbermann/status/1772229730747490691)
- üìñ [Remix new docs - CSS files](https://remix.run/docs/en/main/guides/css-files)
- üìú [Power of Partial Prerendering with Bun](https://aralroca.com/blog/partial-prerendering): An interesting idea, using import attributes to pre-render React components thanks to a Bun macro.
- üìú [A faster React.memo()](https://romgrk.com/posts/react-fast-memo/): Argues that React is using a generic shallowCompare function for React.memo() that could be greatly optimized by using a specialized comparison function that assumes the things to compare are React props.
- üìú [What is a layout in React?](https://www.ericburel.tech/blog/what-layout-means-in-react): A good overview presenting how layouts are implemented differently in Remix, Next.js, or Astro.
- üìú [Diving into the Node.js Website Redesign](https://nodejs.org/en/blog/announcements/diving-into-the-nodejs-website-redesign): Node.js just launched a new Next.js website and shares behind-the-scenes details. They considered Nextra but settled on a custom Next.js setup. The site is statically built, using ISR for dynamic content.
- üìú [This Pattern Will Wreck Your React App's TS Performance](https://www.totaltypescript.com/react-apps-ts-performance): Matt recommends using ‚Äúinterface extends‚Äù instead of ‚Äú&‚Äù, drawing on the story of a Sentry TS perf issue.
- üìú [Utilizing useOptimistic() across the component tree in Next.js](https://aurorascharff.no/posts/utilizing-useoptimistic-across-the-component-tree-in-nextjs/): Explains why and how to share the useOptimistic value through a React context.
- üìú [Why I Like React (even in 2024)](https://ejosh.co/de/2024/03/why-i-like-react-even-in-2024/)
- üìú [Building a ¬´hold to confirm¬ª button with Framer Motion](https://sinja.io/blog/hold-to-confirm-button-react-framer-motion)
- üìú [React useEffect and objects as dependency - 4 approaches to avoid unnecessary re-renders](https://profy.dev/article/react-useeffect-with-object-dependency)
- üìú [React-Three-Fiber - Moebius-style post-processing and other stylized shaders](https://blog.maximeheckel.com/posts/moebius-style-post-processing/)
- üìú [How to Build Your Own ChatGPT Clone Using Clerk & AWS Bedrock](https://conermurphy.com/blog/how-to-build-your-own-chatgpt-clone-using-clerk-aws-bedrock)
- üìú [Exploring useSyncExternalStore, a lesser-known React Hook](https://blog.logrocket.com/exploring-usesyncexternalstore-react-hook/)
- üìú [Remix Case Study - Shopify rebuilding Shop with Remix](https://remix.run/blog/shop-case-study)
- üì¶ [Waku 0.20 - Introducing ‚Äúpages router‚Äù](https://waku.gg/blog/introducing-pages-router): Waku continues to push toward becoming a first-class React meta-framework. The latest release adds a lightweight file-based router and the introduction article presents its conventions. You can choose between static or dynamic rendering on a per-page basis.
- üì¶ [Kotekan - A simple React framework built on Bun, supporting React Server Components](https://kotekan.dev/blog/introducing-kotekan): My co-author Benedikt created his own experimental meta-framework, supporting React Server Components. Unlike other frameworks trying to stay decoupled from a specific runtime, Kotekan leverages tight coupling with Bun for both bundling and runtime. It looks like other interesting things are not mentioned in the intro post, notably a mobile app demo using react-strict-dom and StyleX. That‚Äôs impressive that the website is already built with it.
- üì¶ [Radix Themes 3.0](https://www.radix-ui.com/blog/themes-3): This new version adds custom color palettes, many new components, and a new layout engine.
- üì¶ [shadcn/ui update - Blocks](https://ui.shadcn.com/docs/changelog): Fully responsive, accessible, and composable ready-made components, starting with dashboard layouts and authentication pages.
- üì¶ [@vite-pwa/remix - Zero-config PWA Plugin for Remix](https://github.com/vite-pwa/remix)
- üì¶ [Remotion 4.0.130 - Lambda renders are now faster](https://www.remotion.dev/blog/faster-lambda)
- üé• [Jack Herrington - Finally Fix Your Issues With JS/React Memory Leaks](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qERgb3pWfu0)
- üé• [UI Engineering - Senior-Level Understanding of React Portals](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5F7GrlIPdJ4)
- üé• [Theo - The End Of React Router](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nZKlPtQqqgQ)
- üé• [James Quick - I Didn't Know Next.js Server Actions Could Do This (usage outside forms)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZZCXnNAOqqU)

segments.source_content: [**React Navigation - Introducing Static API**](https://reactnavigation.org/blog/2024/03/25/introducing-static-api)

translations.fr: [**React Navigation - Pr√©sentation de l'API Statique**](https://reactnavigation.org/blog/2024/03/25/introducing-static-api)
translations.en: [**React Navigation - Pr√©sentation de l'API Statique**](https://reactnavigation.org/blog/2024/03/25/introducing-static-api)

segments.source_content: Arguably one of the most used and most important React Native libraries out there is React Navigation. The current major version (6) was introduced roughly three years ago, and now it seems we‚Äôre getting closer to the next major release. With v7 (currently in alpha), React Navigation is (re-)introducing a static API, which lets you define screens from an object configuration. This allows type inference (if you‚Äôve ever created types for a dynamic React Navigation tree you know what that relieves you of) and also makes deep linking config easier (or partly automatic, even).

translations.fr: Sans doute l'une des biblioth√®ques React Native les plus utilis√©es et les plus importantes est React Navigation. La version majeure actuelle (6) a √©t√© introduite il y a environ trois ans, et il semble maintenant que nous nous rapprochions de la prochaine version majeure. Avec la v7 (actuellement en alpha), React Navigation r√©introduit une API statique, qui vous permet de d√©finir les √©crans √† partir d'une configuration objet. Cela permet l'inf√©rence de types (si vous avez d√©j√† cr√©√© des types pour un arbre React Navigation dynamique, vous savez √† quoi cela vous soulage) et rend √©galement la configuration des liens profonds plus facile (voire partiellement automatique).
translations.en: Sans doute l'une des biblioth√®ques React Native les plus utilis√©es et importantes, React Navigation voit sa version majeure actuelle (6) introduite il y a environ trois ans. Avec la v7 (actuellement en alpha), React Navigation r√©introduit une API statique permettant de d√©finir les √©crans via une configuration objet. Cela permet l'inf√©rence de types (si vous avez d√©j√† cr√©√© des types pour un arbre React Navigation dynamique, vous savez le gain que cela repr√©sente) et facilite √©galement la configuration des liens profonds (voire la rend partiellement automatique).

segments.source_content: Make sure to also read the [v7 upgrade guide](https://reactnavigation.org/docs/7.x/upgrading-from-6.x/) if you want to know about other changes coming!

translations.fr: Assurez-vous √©galement de lire le [guide de mise √† niveau v7](https://reactnavigation.org/docs/7.x/upgrading-from-6.x/) si vous voulez conna√Ætre les autres changements √† venir !
translations.en: Consultez √©galement le [guide de mise √† niveau v7](https://reactnavigation.org/docs/7.x/upgrading-from-6.x/) pour conna√Ætre les autres changements √† venir !

segments.source_content:
- üí∏ [Omlet - Measure React Native component usage in production. Track adoption and get data for codebase improvements in \<5 minutes setup](https://omlet.dev/?utm_campaign=partner_this-week-in-react_newsletter-quick-link-rn-mar-2024)
- üê¶ [React Native Server Components on visionOS demo](https://twitter.com/SzymonRybczak/status/1772987077488935208)
- üìú [Building multi-window applications with React Native visionOS](https://www.oskarkwasniewski.dev/blog/react-native-visionos-multi-window-apps): Learn how to not only enable multiple windows in visionOS apps, but also how to share React state between them.
- üìú [Expo - How to replace App Center and CodePush](https://expo.dev/blog/how-to-replace-app-center-and-codepush): As reported last week, CodePush is shutting down on March 31, 2025.
- üìú Two Expo case studies: [Win your March Madness bracket with this Expo app](https://expo.dev/blog/march-madness-expo-app) and [incident.io harnesses the power of native modules and CNG](https://expo.dev/blog/incident-io-harnesses-the-power-of-native-modules-and-cng)
- üìú [Rethinking Layout Practices - A minimalistic Stack component that sets the foundation for doing layout well](https://www.reactnative.university/blog/rethinking-layout-practices): Interesting take: Never layout using padding or margin on Text or View components and instead introduce a Stack component (Tamagui does this for example).
- üìú [Optimize Your React Native App‚Äôs JavaScript Bundle](https://www.callstack.com/blog/optimize-react-native-apps-javascript-bundle): The title doesn‚Äôt give it away, but this is an interesting overview of alternative bundlers for RN. Sadly, all of these still have pretty big trade-offs compared to Metro.
- üìú [How To Add Social Auth With AWS Amplify And React Native?](https://scientyficworld.org/social-auth-with-aws-amplify-and-react-native/)
- üìú [Optimize React Native Apps' Battery Drain With Mobile-Dedicated Libraries](https://www.callstack.com/blog/optimize-battery-drain-in-react-native-apps)
- üìú [How Can Higher-Order Components Improve Performance of React Native Apps?](https://www.callstack.com/blog/improve-react-native-performance-with-higher-ordered-components)
- üì¶ [@dev-plugins/redux](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@dev-plugins/redux): Plugin for Expo Dev Tools to debug Redux stores.
- üì¶ [react-native-screens 3.30.0](https://github.com/software-mansion/react-native-screens/releases/tag/3.30.0): Now includes a "go back" gesture and supports visionOS
- üì¶ [react-native 0.74.0-rc.5](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/releases/tag/v0.74.0-rc.5)
- üéôÔ∏è [RNR 292 - RNR Explains: Metro Bundler](https://reactnativeradio.com/episodes/rnr-292-rnr-explains-metro-bundler)
- üé• [Theo - The New React Native Architecture](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BdPkVl4Y8TQ)
- üé• [Rocket Ship 35 - React Native Skia with William Candillon](https://share.transistor.fm/s/15269c3f)
- üé• [Simon: Build a FinTech Clone with React Native (API Routes, Zustand, Tanstack Query, FaceID, Charts, Clerk)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iDZBeIgcixk): Usually we pick short, but valuable videos to save you time. This one is over 5¬Ω hours long(!), but I highly recommend it if you want to observe a state-of-the-art RN app build from start to finish.

translations.en:
- üí∏ [Omlet - Mesurez l'utilisation des composants React Native en production. Suivez l'adoption et obtenez des donn√©es pour am√©liorer la base de code en moins de 5 minutes de configuration](https://omlet.dev/?utm_campaign=partner_this-week-in-react_newsletter-quick-link-rn-mar-2024)
- üê¶ [D√©monstration des composants serveur React Native sur visionOS](https://twitter.com/SzymonRybczak/status/1772987077488935208)
- üìú [Cr√©ation d'applications multi-fen√™tres avec React Native visionOS](https://www.oskarkwasniewski.dev/blog/react-native-visionos-multi-window-apps) : Apprenez non seulement √† activer plusieurs fen√™tres dans les applications visionOS, mais aussi √† partager l'√©tat React entre elles.
- üìú [Expo - Comment remplacer App Center et CodePush](https://expo.dev/blog/how-to-replace-app-center-and-codepush) : Comme rapport√© la semaine derni√®re, CodePush fermera ses portes le 31 mars 2025.
- üìú Deux √©tudes de cas Expo : [Gagnez votre bracket March Madness avec cette application Expo](https://expo.dev/blog/march-madness-expo-app) et [incident.io exploite la puissance des modules natifs et du CNG](https://expo.dev/blog/incident-io-harnesses-the-power-of-native-modules-and-cng)
- üìú [Repenser les pratiques de mise en page - Un composant Stack minimaliste qui jette les bases d'une bonne mise en page](https://www.reactnative.university/blog/rethinking-layout-practices) : Point de vue int√©ressant : Ne jamais utiliser de padding ou de margin sur les composants Text ou View pour la mise en page et √† la place introduire un composant Stack (Tamagui fait cela par exemple).
- üìú [Optimisez le bundle JavaScript de votre application React Native](https://www.callstack.com/blog/optimize-react-native-apps-javascript-bundle) : Le titre ne le r√©v√®le pas, mais il s'agit d'un aper√ßu int√©ressant des bundlers alternatifs pour RN. Malheureusement, tous pr√©sentent encore des compromis assez importants par rapport √† Metro.
- üìú [Comment ajouter une authentification sociale avec AWS Amplify et React Native ?](https://scientyficworld.org/social-auth-with-aws-amplify-and-react-native/)
- üìú [Optimisez la consommation de batterie des applications React Native avec des biblioth√®ques d√©di√©es au mobile](https://www.callstack.com/blog/optimize-battery-drain-in-react-native-apps)
- üìú [Comment les composants d'ordre sup√©rieur peuvent-ils am√©liorer les performances des applications React Native ?](https://www.callstack.com/blog/improve-react-native-performance-with-higher-ordered-components)
- üì¶ [@dev-plugins/redux](https://www.npmjs.com/package/@dev-plugins/redux) : Plugin pour Expo Dev Tools pour d√©boguer les stores Redux.
- üì¶ [react-native-screens 3.30.0](https://github.com/software-mansion/react-native-screens/releases/tag/3.30.0) : Inclut d√©sormais un geste de retour et prend en charge visionOS.
- üì¶ [react-native 0.74.0-rc.5](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/releases/tag/v0.74.0-rc.5)
- üéôÔ∏è [RNR 292 - RNR explique : Metro Bundler](https://reactnativeradio.com/episodes/rnr-292-rnr-explains-metro-bundler)
- üé• [Theo - La nouvelle architecture React Native](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BdPkVl4Y8TQ)
- üé• [Rocket Ship 35 - React Native Skia avec William Candillon](https://share.transistor.fm/s/15269c3f)
- üé• [Simon : Construisez un clone FinTech avec React Native (API Routes, Zustand, Tanstack Query, FaceID, Charts, Clerk)](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iDZBeIgcixk) : Habituellement, nous s√©lectionnons des vid√©os courtes mais pr√©cieuses pour vous faire gagner du temps. Celle-ci dure plus de 5 heures et demie (!), mais je la recommande vivement si vous voulez observer la construction d'une application RN de pointe du d√©but √† la fin.
